Coupled with oral divorce is the heinous practice of nikah halala which also must be abolished,\" Kumaramangalam said.
The body has also said that verbal divorce finds no mention in the Quran and such a practice is un-Islamic.
They are demanding that the Muslim personal law be amended to safeguard Muslim women\'s rights.

story.storybody:
Members of a women's rights group have approached the National Commission for Women (NCW) seeking its support to abolish the practice of triple talaq, terming it as an "un-Quranic" practice.

The Bharatiya Muslim Mahila Andolan in its letter to NCW chief Lalitha Kumaramangalam claimed that it has collected 50,000 signatures in support of its campaign and is writing to Women's Commissions of different states for their support.

HERE'S WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW:

{funfacts}
  1. In its letter, the women's rights group claims that 92 per cent Muslim women are against triple talaq and want it to be abolished.
  2. "We have found that women want a legal ban on the practice of oral/unilateral divorce. Our national study 'Seeking Justice Within Family' found that 92 per cent of Muslim women want an end to this practice which destroys their life and the lives of their children. Coupled with oral divorce is the heinous practice of nikah halala which also must be abolished," Kumaramangalam said.
  3. The body has also said that verbal divorce finds no mention in the Quran and such a practice is un-Islamic.
  4. They are demanding that the Muslim personal law be amended to safeguard Muslim women's rights.
  5. The body said that on a mere pronouncement of talaq thrice, the woman gets instantly and irrevocably divorced and becomes a "destitute" overnight.
  6. The women's body also sought equal citizenship rights for Muslims as enshrined in the Constitution as well as justice and equality for Muslim women based on the "Quranic tenets".
  7. Interestingly, many Muslim countries, like Pakistan and Indonesia, a country that has the largest Muslim population, have banned triple talaq.
{funfacts}
